text: Post-Futurism (alternatively Postfuturism) is a term coined by Vivian Sobchack to describe certain science fiction films of the late 1970s and early 1980s,Vivian Sobchack, Screening Space: The American Science Fiction Film, Rutgers University Press, 1997, p. 223. a genre of science fiction, an artistic movement, and an architectural movement. In the past the term has been used as a synonym for Postmodernism.Raymond Federman, Critifiction: Postmodern Essays, SUNY Press, 1993, p. 129. ==References== Category:Future Category:Science fiction genres Category:Literary movements Category:Art movements Category:20th-century literature
title: Post-Futurism
